inn1.comm: starts with a wide outside off stump, wasn't too wide though, angling across the right-hander
good length, pitching in line with the stumps and angling across, Amla stays in his crease and blocks
first runs for South Africa, two fielders scamper after the ball as Amla goes back and plays a cover drive through cover point, Guptill gets to it first
a full ball strays down leg side to the left-hander, not as tidy a start from Boult today
good length around off stump, de Kock stays in his crease and defends
punched past the bowler but mid-on cuts it off
a length ball with width outside off, de Kock stays back and opens the face to steer the ball through point
de Kock finding his touch early, staying in his crease and using the width outside off to punch through cover
good length outside off stump, Amla watches it go past
back of the a length outside off, moves away from Amla who plays and misses
Southee pitches on a good length and angles the ball into the right-hander, Amla stays in his crease and tries to glance but mis-times it and is hit on the thigh
good length and straight this time, Amla is right behind the line and defends with a straight bat
mid-on runs in to field after Amla pushes another good length delivery from his crease with a straight bat
a tight start from Southee, the length and line around off gives Amla very little to work with, defended on the off side
good length angling into the left-hander, de Kock presses forward and defends on the off side
short of a length outside off, de Kock punches into the covers where Guptill dives and deflects the ball away from the man at mid-on to allow the single
short of a length angling across Amla from over the wicket, he shoulders arms
Boult gets the ball to bounce and move into Amla after angling across him, Amla was caught in his crease and hit on the thigh
Amla stays back and defends, not convincingly, the ball bounces near his feet and goes to first slip
punched from the crease past the bowler to mid-off
a fuller ball on a straighter line, allows de Kock to clip the ball off the pads through square
Amla has a swish at a good length ball outside off and is beaten, he hasn't looked as fluent as de Kock has today
banged in short and that hurried Amla, he tried to pull but the ball got very high on him and he mistimed it completely towards midwicket
de Kock was looking to play that on the leg side but the full ball squared him up and went off the leading edge towards point
edged but there's no second slip, de Kock played away from his body at one that angled across him and got a thick outside edge, there is a third man though
good length on middle, Amla stays in his crease and blocks
played from the crease towards mid-on
de Kock moves towards the off and plays a good length ball towards mid-off
de Kock stays in his crease and plays the ball with an angled and closed bat towards the leg side
a fuller length around off, de Kock drives from his crease but mis-times it towards mid-off
banged in short and de Kock manages to get on top of the bounce and pull it away through midwicket, he did not time it well enough to get four though
hits a great length outside off and gets the ball to straighten a touch on de Kock, the batsman pushed forward and played for the angle into him but was beaten on the forward defence

a missed chance. Edged but neither the keeper nor first slip goes for it! Amla was caught in his crease as he pushed tentatively at one that pitched on a good length and seamed slightly away from him. Neither Ronchi nor Latham moved, just looked at each other. Keeper's catch but I think he was wrong footed.
defended on the off side
short of a length and Amla swivels and pulls the ball in front of square leg, once again the timing isn't perfect
a fuller length on the pads, de Kock stays back and glances but can't beat short fine leg
first proper boundary of the day! A half volley on the pads and de Kock flicks it crisply through square leg, there's a fielder in the deep but the timing is good enough to beat him
good length just outside off, defended on the back foot on the off side
good length outside off, Amla stays back and defends towards point
short of a length angling across the right-hander, Amla moves across in his crease, gets on his toes, lifts his front foot in the air as he flicks the ball through square

de Kock is in quite a bit of pain after getting hit on his left forearm. He was beaten for pace as the short of a length ball bounced and seamed into him from over the wicket, he tried to defend but the ball burst through his defences and crashed into his bottom hand. He dropped his bat immediately and walked away, taking off his glove and wincing. He's on his haunches now and the physio is having a look at the hand. He is going to continue batting
short of a length just outside off, de Kock stays in his crease and defends towards cover
short and wide outside off, plenty of width for de Kock and he flays the ball through point with a forceful cut, winced a bit as he made contact with the ball but the timing was great
defended from the crease on the leg side
Amla gets behind the line of a good length ball and defends to the bowler with a straight bat
good length just outside off stump, Amla stays in his crease and shoulders arms
goes back to a length ball and defends watchfully on the off side
good length angling into off and middle, tight line, Amla gets behind it and plays with a straight bat towards mid-on

what on earth has happened there? Another chance isn't attempted. Amla went after a Southee short ball and pulled, he got a top edge that went in the direction of fine leg. Vettori was on the boundary and he completely misjudged it. He did not run in at all. Did he think the ball was going to carry to him, or did he just not see it? In the end it fell about 15-20 metres short. Bizarre.
defended on the off side
strays down leg side, de Kock misses the glance and the umpire does not call it wide
played from the crease towards mid-on

stunning fielding! But Guptill misses the direct hit at the bowler's end with de Kock stranded mid-pitch. De Kock pushed the ball firmly to backward point and tried to steal the single to the wrong fielder. Guptill dived to his left, collected the ball after it was almost past him and bounced up in a flash. He had all the time in the world to line up the throw, de Kock had given up. But Guptill missed. Bad call from de Kock
pushed off the back foot towards point
Amla stays back and defends on the off side
driven off the front foot towards cover where McCullum dives and cuts off the shot
a lovely drive, is Amla finding his groove? He was superbly balanced as he leaned forward to a full ball and drove it through extra cover
stays back to a good length ball and opens the face to steer the ball late into the ground and past first slip
a poor line with fine leg in the circle, on the pads, de Kock glances towards the fielder behind square and there's a bit of a fumble
banged in short and Amla ducks under it
Amla stays in his crease and takes one hand off his bat as he drives a good length ball to one of the two catchers at cover
Amla defends the last ball of the mandatory Powerplay on the off side
short of a length with width outside off, de Kock stays in his crease and bunts the ball firmly between the bowler and mid-off, played it with an almost horizontal bat and timed it supremely
wide outside off once again, de Kock reaches for it and then checks his shot, gets a bottom edge into the pitch
short ball and de Kock swats it through midwicket, McClenaghan falls over in his follow through
Amla gets behind the line of a good length ball angling across him and defends with a straight bat
a bouncer, Amla tries to hook it but can't make contact
a fuller length on leg stump, Amla stays back and flicks the ball through midwicket, there's a fielder in the deep
a fullish delivery angling across the right-hander, Amla drives from his crease but mis-times it towards extra cover
he has not mis-timed this! Amla has width outside off and this time he moves forward smoothly and drives the full ball perfectly to the cover boundary
played off the front foot past the bowler towards mid-off
short of a length angling across the right-hander, Amla moves back and across in his crease and swats the ball down from outside off stump through midwicket for a single
a fullish ball from Anderson, angling into de Kock, who presses forward and pushes the ball wide of Southee at mid-off for a quick single
Amla stays in his crease and drives the ball to mid-off. Anderson has shortened his length to Amla after beginning with two full ones

short of a length outside off stump, de Kock defends on the off side. It's been called a no-ball because McClenaghan got too close to the stumps as he delivered and knocked off the bails. One of the newer rules in ODIs
de Kock stays in his crease and pushes at one outside off, gets an outside edge behind point towards third man
Amla drives into the covers for a single

bowled off the inside edge! The ball was full outside off and de Kock was not forward as he played a hard swatty-slog. Not too sure where he was trying to hit the ball. It looked like a golf swing that he stopped mid-way. McClenaghan celebrates after he sees the ball ricochet on to the stumps. The umpires check the front-foot no-ball; McClenaghan was just safe
du Plessis is off the mark with a gentle flick on the leg side
Amla stays back and tries to play the ball down towards third man, does not time it
that ball has taken off, a sharp bouncer that squares Amla up as he tries to let it go, it's been judged to be too high by the umpire though
defended off the back foot on the off side
defended on the back foot towards backward point
Faf stays back and tries to dab the ball towards third man as it bounces across him from short of a length, does not get past second slip
short of a length and straight, defended from the crease

short of a length again but too straight, Faf goes back and glances through vacant square leg, should have been a comfortable two but Anderson chases after the ball and slides, making Faf hurry back for the second
defended on the back foot towards cover
too short and Faf is able to go back and pull through square leg, the fielder running from fine leg is Vettori, probably the slowest on the field and the ball beats him
Amla chips a short of a length ball angling across him towards third man
good length, but Amla moves deep in his crease and across his stumps to dab the ball off his pads towards midwicket
a graceful shot from Faf, he moves back to a short of a length delivery and punches firmly, finding the small gap at cover and giving the fielder a tight chase to prevent the boundary
worked off the pads on the back foot behind square leg
banged in short and right at the head, Faf keeps his eyes on the ball and weaves out of the way in time
good length, pitching in line with the stumps and angling across, left alone by the batsman
short of a length, punched from the crease towards mid-on
that's a superb shot, Amla moves right across his crease to a length ball and flicks it from off stump with the angle into him to the square leg boundary
Boult goes wide outside off to compensate for Amla's previous movement and is a bit too short, Amla stays back and flays him to the cover boundary
good length angling across the right-hander, Amla lets it go
too straight this time, Amla works the ball off his hips behind square
dabbed off the back foot behind point for a single. time for a drinks break.
tight length on off stump, Faf goes back and plays towards point
Faf goes back to one that is a bit straighter, on middle stump, and taps it into the gap between square leg and midwicket
there's width outside off for Amla and the length is on the shorter side as well, Amla cuts hard but can't beat point
Amla tries to drive but is beaten by the one that goes on with the arm outside off
driven to cover but does not beat the infield
moves back and across and nudges into the leg side
good length on middle, Faf goes back and dabs the ball into the leg side for a single
Amla gets on top of the bounce of a short ball and pulls off the back foot through square
defended from the crease on the off side
that' a ripper from Neesham, bounced sharply from a good length and beat Faf as he prodded forward
short of a length and Faf meets it with a pull through midwicket, didn't time it perfectly though
played towards point
Amla stays in his crease and nudges to midwicket
steps out and drives the ball hard and straight, Vettori does well to dive to his left and field
goes back and plays the ball to midwicket
Amla makes room against the angle into him from round the wicket and drives hard, can't beat mid-off. Amla wants to go inside out, but does not have the room
this time he manages to execute! The length is fuller so Amla moves slightly towards the leg side and drills the ball through cover with a fluent drive
pushed through covers for another single
defended on the back foot towards point
moves back and across and works a short of a length delivery off his hips towards long leg
that's a tremendous shot! It was a length ball and Faf came forward, got under it and punched, not much of a follow through but he hit it on the up and cleared the long-off boundary
hits it to the straight boundary behind him this time! Faf wanted to carve the short ball over point but got a top edge that went over the keeper
played to point
nudged off the back foot towards square leg for a single
steps put to one that angles into him from round the wicket and clips it in front of square to bring up the 50 stand off 46 balls
steps out and drives the ball to long off, Vettori tries to dive and cut it off but can't
played gently into the covers
defended back to the bowler
stays in his crease and punches a good length ball from off to cover
played with soft hands towards point and they sprint the single
defended on the back foot behind point, it was a length ball outside off
No, says Faf after dabbing a short of a length ball behind point
a poor line and length, full and down leg side, Faf glances towards fine leg and the fielder on the boundary does well to dive and save two runs
good length around off, that ball gripped the pitch a bit, Faf opened up his stance and defended towards cover
a fuller ball around off and middle, Faf meets it on the front foot and dabs towards midwicket for a single

banged in short by Southee but The Punisher is not bothered in the least. He calmly sways a little to get out of the line and then uses his bat like a ramp, the ball bounces off it and flies to the third man boundary
worked through square leg for a single
pushed down the ground to long off for a single
lofted hard towards long on, that that was headed for a certain boundary until Latham came racing across and fielded it on the bounce just as it was about to go over
defended on the front foot on the leg side
played off the back foot to the fielder at cover
moves across his stumps and nudges to midwicket
short of a length angling into the right-hander, working off the back foot through square leg
nudged from the crease through midwicket
left alone outside off stump, that was on a good length and around 132 kph
Amla stays in his crease and drives to mid-off, they take on the fielder because he is on the edge of the circle
worked off the back foot through midwicket for a single
driven firmly but can't find the gap at cover
goes back and punches a length ball past the diving fielder at cover
Amla stays still in his crease and nudges the ball off his pads to short fine leg
punched from the crease towards cover
goes back and hits the ball through cover
flicked off the pads behind square for one more
steps out and hits the ball to midwicket but a fielder is in the way
130 kph, a length ball angling across Amla, who uses the width to drive hard off the back foot, can't beat short cover though
a straighter line, 131 kph, Amla clips through square leg
defended off the back foot towards point
Faf steps out to a short ball and pulls through midwicket
a length ball outside off, Amla punches on the up towards mid-off
McClenaghan knocks over the bails as he delivers so that's going to be a no-ball as well, driven through cover to the fielder in the deep
Faf steps out again and swats a short of a length ball through midwicket, didn't look as crisp and clean as he usually does playing shots
pushed into the covers
tries to cut off the back foot but gets an edge into his pads
hit towards long off for a single
a slow one outside off, punched off the back foot to cover
not much room outside off so Faf is beaten on the back foot cut, that was quicker from Vettori
goes back and plays towards silly mid on, Vettori runs across and then does a back flick to try and run out Amla, concedes an overthrow in the process
that's too short and even though the line is outside off there is plenty of time to pull, Faf hammers it into the gap on the midwicket boundary

has that been caught at slip? The celebrations begin but then they die out quickly because the ball has not carried. The ball bounced a few inches short of Latham's hands at first slip. Faf was trying to run the ball to third man but it bounced a bit more on him
steps out and lofts the ball inside out over cover
worked off the back foot towards wide mid on for a single to bring up a brisk half-century
full outside off, gets beaten as he tries to steer to third man
a full ball angling into the right-hander, Amla tries to drive straight but the ball goes to point off the thick outside edge
Vettori dives across the pitch to cut off a firm on-drive
defended back to the bowler
played off the back foot on the off side
goes deep into his crease and cuts the ball from just outside off stump through point
punched off the front foot towards long off, McCullum tries to cut it off at cover with a dive but can't
pushed to long on for a single this time
a length ball on middle and off, Faf stays in his crease and plays a swat in front of square leg
a length ball outside off, Amla runs it down to third man, South Africa on cruise control at the moment

shouts of catch from some fielders, but perhaps they meant someone in the crowd. Faf came out of his crease to a length ball and lofted it cleanly over the long-off boundary. 86-metre six, according to television
steered to third man for another single
Amla moves back and across to a short of a length ball and drives through cover point
pushed gently towards wide mid-on and they take on Neesham and complete the quick single
bowled on a good length on off and middle, played off the front foot to the bowler
pushed into the covers from the crease
driven on the front foot to the bowler
goes back and opens the face to square drive the ball through point
played off the back foot through covers for one more
driven on the front foot towards long on for a single
tossed up full on off and middle, Faf perhaps wanted to see what Guptill would deliver, for he just gently tapped it to long on
worked through midwicket for another single
moves outside leg, Guptill follows him to deny room, clipped off the pads through square
Amla stays in his crease and drives to long off
defended from the crease behind square on the leg side
played to long on for a single to end the over
played off the back foot towards cover
punched with a straight bat wide off the bowler towards long on
pushed into the covers, Vettori is bowling tightly but they are showing him a lot of respect
whoops, jinxed it, width outside off and Amla is able to go back and late cut between the fielders at short third man and backward point
played to square leg
defended to midwicket off the front foot

caught behind! A sharp one from Neesham! It pitched on a good length just outside off and bounced more than Faf expected. He stayed in his crease and tried to run it down to third man but the bounce made the ball graze the edge for a comfortable catch to the wicketkeeper Ronchi
driven off the back foot through point for a single
Amla stands tall on the back foot and drives a length  delivery through point
AB skips out of the crease - it's only his second ball - and drives fluently through covers
good length on off and middle, defended from the crease to the bowler, it was a slower one from Neesham
short and wide outside off, Amla cuts but there is a fielder on the cover boundary
Amla nudges from his crease and plays it uppishly towards the non-striker, Vettori can't dive across in time, Amla played a bit early and got a leading edge
amazing from AB! He steps out, gets outside the line of off stump, gets down on one knee and sweeps into the gap on the square leg boundary. How much time does he have to play his shots!
fuller ball driven to long off for a single
too much width from Vettori, Amla makes room by moving outside leg and lofts inside out into the gap on the cover boundary
steps forward and towards the off side this time to nudge the ball through midwicket
plays the ball to midwicket where Guptill is the fielder, so they decide against the single. That's Vettori done for the day, with the ball that is.
a length ball pitching in line with the stumps and angling across Amla, who stays still in his crease and punches firmly to cover
uses the width outside off to go back and cut to deep point
too full, too wide and AB helps himself by driving to the cover boundary, wonderful timing
whoa! AB ended up mis-timing that a touch but still hit it well enough to clear the cover boundary. AB charged the bowler and swung hard, the bat turning in his hand as he made contact
driven off the front foot into the covers for a single
Amla drives off the back foot through point for one more
cramps Amla for room with the angle into the right-hander, played off the back foot towards point
width outside off stump this time and Amla cuts it down to third man
short of a length outside off, AB flat-bats it towards point
a fuller ball angling into AB, who drives it off his pads through wide mid-on

excitement from the crowd as they think it's been caught at point. Is it a bump ball? The umpires are having a minor check and they confirm that Amla jammed the ball into the ground and then it lobbed up to point
cut to backward point, there was lots of room there
a deft push to long-off brings up South Africa's 200. De Villiers will be looking at a hundred more runs from here
and these shots will help, he was on the front foot but this pitch is slow enough for him to pull the short ball from there to the midwicket boundary
full and outside off, Amla slaps it down to mid-off
Soutthee runs around from deep square leg, slides and sticks out a hand to try and rein another Amla pull back. But it's been hit too well. Sat up for him and he dined out
full and slanted in at the pads, Amla tucks it towards short midwicket
shortish but outside off this time as Amla rolled his wrists on top of it and taps it through to deep point
firmly in death bowling mode as he looks for a wide yorker. Amla nips across outside off and tries to slice it towards third man, doesn't connect
shuffles across and whips a fuller ball that was angled in at him through to deep midwicket
banged in short and it was rising up towards AB's helmet, not much room to enable the pull either. So AB swats it down wide of mid-on and still manages to power it through
nips down the track, but Mitch digs this in again to cramp AB up
full and wide outside off, AB was trying to make a bit of room for himself and thread it through the covers. Bunts it back at the bowler instead
full and angled in on middle and leg, AB pushes it down to long-on
worked off the pads to midwicket
Amla tries to play straight but the ball sliding across him hits the outside edge and goes to point
short ball and Amla tries to pull but can't beat short fine leg
a fuller ball on middle and leg, driven to long on for a single
another short ball, Amla is beaten on the pull this time
chipped down to long on for a single to bring up the 50 partnership
Southee returns and bowls a length ball with width outside off, Amla cuts off the back foot to the fielder at deep point
played off the pads from the crease to square leg
AB moves across his crease towards the off early, Southee tries to counter with a slower ball but AB is good enough to wait and glance fine past the keeper
AB steps out to a fuller ball and clips off his toes, can't beat the man at square leg

that's a high full toss and it's hit AB and caused him pain. New Zealand are appealing for lbw though but the umpire says not out. AB is dealing with the blow but in the meantime New Zealand have asked for a review. AB had tried to play a reverse pull but was surprised by the high full toss and hit just below the hip. The impact was just outside off stump though, so I think he will be okay.
flicked to deep midwicket for a single
makes room and drives the ball inside out through cover
driven off the front foot to cover
banged in short and Amla pulls the ball behind square
a slower ball, nearly in the blockhole at 110 kph, Amla digs it out towards the bowler
another slower ball outside off, keeps a bit low too, Amla tries to pull but is beaten on the bottom edge
that's a wide down leg side

good length and on middle and off, Amla dabs the ball off the back foot just wide of the keeper and AB calls him through, Ronchi moves quickly and throws at the striker's end but misses. AB would have been home though
Amla works a short of a length ball off his hips towards Vettori at long leg, they decide against the second
a slower straight full toss that dips on the batsman, AB is too good for such tricks though, he clears his front leg and drives it dead straight past the bowler, all long the ground

he's gone this time! AB was looking to smash the ball for a six over the leg side but got a top edge that went straight up in the air and fell into Ronchi's gloves. Tremendous breakthrough for Southee and New Zealand. That skier was swirling so Ronchi did well to judge it.
a hundred for Amla, New Zealand didn't attempt two catches off him and it has cost them. Amla gets to the landmark by driving the ball firmly through cover point
Duminy punches the length ball from his crease through point
Amla makes a bit of room and drives a good length ball inside out in front of point
too good from Amla, not much room to work with so Amla creates some by moving a little outside leg and cutting hard off the back foot, wide of the fielder at third man
this time he goes the other side, Amla flicks a full ball powerfully towards deep midwicket and beats Neesham's full length dive
three in a row, Amla sends a slower ball down leg side by glancing fine, between the keeper and short fine leg
that's the fourth consecutive four! A streaky one this time. He tried to drive powerfully at a wide ball and edged it between the keeper and short third man
driven to long on for two hard-run runs
cut off the back foot to point
short of a length and straight, Duminy stays in his crease and works the ball through midwicket

bowled him! Amla moved outside leg too early, giving Southee a full view of the stumps. Amla then tried to steer the ball to third man but Southee shortened his length to beat the bat and hit the stumps. He goes after a superb innings
a full and straight delivery, Miller clips it to midwicket
Miller flicks the ball firmly towards midwicket, the ball doesn't get past the infield because of some sublime fielding but there's still time for a single
short of a length delivery and Duminy pulls through square leg
Miller moves forward to a good length ball around off and defends with a straight bat
the full toss dips on Duminy, he can't get under it so ends up playing it to cover
played to wide long on for a single
another low full toss, driven along the ground to long off for one more
Duminy steps out but Guptill's length is good and he can't get under the ball, drives it to long on
worked off the pads through midwicket
a full ball angling into the left-hander from round the wicket, Duminy flicks in front of square leg, tidy over from Guptill, only singles off it
Duminy charges and swings but is beaten by the ball that slants across the left-hander from round the wicket
Duminy stays in his crease this time, move across a little to flick the ball to square leg, can't beat the fielder
Duminy pulls a length ball, he was looking to come forward again, mis-timed to deep midwicket ... South Africa have lost a bit of steam
Miller can only push the good length ball firmly to mid-off
width outside off stump, Duminy uses it to cut the ball through point, thy run quickly and come back for the second
Duminy steps out and mis-times another pull through midwicket, New Zealand are finishing nicely here
too short from Boult, so much time for Duminy to line him up and pull the slower ball through square leg for four more
mid-off is in the circle and Duminy lofts a full ball over the fielder for another four, he just hit through the line
pushed through mid-on for a single
Miller turns the strike over by driving through covers

lbw! That looked like a slower ball out of the back of the hand and after the umpire raises his finger quickly, Duminy asks for a review. He had moved a long way across his stumps to turn the ball off his pads and was hit in front of middle. There was no bat on it and the ball hit just above the knee roll. So that looks pretty good for New Zealand. Replays indicate that it's an umpire's call on height so Duminy's on his way

he's gone first ball! Rossouw tries to drive in sixth gear from the start, slogging across the line. He drags a good length slower ball from outside off stump and hits it straight to Guptill on the deep midwicket boundary.
Miller is cramped for room by the line from round the wicket and dabs it on the off side for a single
good length on off and middle from round the wicket, Philander defends on the off side
Philander slogs a short of a length ball through midwicket for a single
Miller does not have room to free those arms so he ends up chipping the ball tamely towards long off, falls well short of the fielder
Philander makes room and throws his bat at the ball, aiming for the deep point boundary, he does not beat the infield

another wicket falls, McClenaghan gets his 50th ODI wicket. He bangs the ball in short and rushes Philander on the pull. The batsman mis-times the shot and holes out to Brownlie ho comes running in from the miwicket boundary to take the catch. McClenaghan is joint second on the list of bowlers quickest to 50 ODI wickets.
Steyn backed away a bit too early outside leg and was in no position to play a shot to a short ball outside off stump

Steyn's gone as well. What a limp finish from South Africa. He stepped out and slogged, was cramped for room and got a top edge that went straight up in the air. Ronchi ran in to take the catch near the stumps
Miller's gone now. He hasn't been able to get going at all. Anderson bowls on a good length and straight, Miller clears his front foot and slogs across the line, gets an inside edge on to his stumps
short of a length around off stump, Tahir defends on the off side and decides not to take on the fielder running in from point
short of a length again outside off, gets big on Tahir and beats the bat as he fends outside off
top finish from Anderson, he beats the bat again and the batsmen don't even attempt to steal a bye. A strange finish to the innings.

inn2.comm: good length angling into the right-hander, Guptill tries to nudge on the leg side but misses and is hit on the thigh
presses forward to a fuller ball and defends towards point
short of a length at the body, Guptill moves across and swivels to pull the ball behind square
Neesham has a go outside off with no footwork at all, gets beaten by a good length ball that angles across him from over the wicket
137 kph, Steyn sends down a bouncer but the line is down leg side, that did not trouble Neesham
good length outside off, movement away from the left-hander, Neesham stays in his crease and shoulders arms
that's a much better short ball, on top of the stumps, Neesham has to drop his wrists and sway out of the line
a full ball on middle and leg, Guptill drives firmly to mid-on where Tahir lets it go past to concede runs
132 kph, good length just outside off stump, Guptill moves forward and across to cover off stump before shouldering arms
good length and closer to the stumps, Guptill moves forward and across to defend to the man at short midwicket
defended on the front foot with a straight bat towards the bowler, solid from Guptill
beaten! Philander hits the perfect length around off stump and nibbles the ball away from Guptill, the batsman was caught on the crease, squared up and beaten as he tried to defend
pushes to mid-off and they are running a risky single to Miller but he doesn't pick up cleanly!
a good length ball just around off stump around 142 kph, a bit of extra bounce at that pace, Guptill stays in his crease and plays to point
straighter line this time, drifting on to leg at 137 kph, Guptill can't connect with the glance and gets hit on the pad, leg bye to square leg
Neesham gets behind the line of a good length ball on middle and off and defends with a straight bat to the bowler
good length around off, 136 kph, Neesham presses forward and defends on the off side
138 kph, that is a sharp bouncer and Neesham is in such a hurry to duck under it that he loses balance and falls to the ground
another bouncer to end the over, this time Neesham looks more assured while leaving it, just moves inside the line and lets it pass
good length around off, that's Philander's stock length, Guptill moves forward and defends on the off side, looks up to see if Neesham is interested in the quick single, he isn't
strays on to leg and Guptill is able to tuck the ball off his pads behind square

Guptill gets his partner off the mark with a sharp call for a single. Neesham had just defended the ball on the back foot close on the off side. He wasn't initiating the single but Guptill ran in a flash
tries to flick but closed the face of the bat too early, the ball went towards the bowler

what on earth! South Africa are dozing in the field. Guptill tried to short-arm pull a ball that wasn't too short and ended up playing too early. The ball lobbed off the top edge behind square leg. AB de Villiers ran back from square leg and Steyn ran in from short fine leg. In the end no one called for the catch and both gave half-hearted efforts. The ball fell between them. Someone should have just called for it and gone quickly.
defended from the crease towards midwicket
defended on the front foot on the off side
a firm drive off the front foot to a fuller ball but Neesham can't beat mid-off
Miller chases after the ball from mid-off and pulls it in just inside the boundary. Neesham had driven that firmly off the front foot through the gap, nicely timed
nice! Guptill moves across towards the off side, gets on his toes to get on top of the bounce and pulls the ball down through the gap at midwicket
closes the face too early and gets an outside edge towards point where the fielder dives to his left to prevent the ball going past
played off the hips towards square leg, Neesham says no after the fielder runs in quickly
defended on the front foot towards the bowler, tight length from Philander around off stump
a good length and straight ball, Nessham drives from his crease and the fielder at mid-on is on the edge of the circle so there is time for a single
cut hard off the back foot but Faf dives to his left at point to save runs
defended from the crease towards the bowler
good length on off and middle, Guptill presses forward and across and defends towards the bowler
moves forward and outside the line of off stump to defend on the off side
Neesham tries to make room and drive off the back foot but gets a thick outside edge wide of AB at second slip
lets this one go outside off stump
140 kph, Neesham hits the ball hard into the covers where Miller dives to his left and saves three runs, that was four had it beat the infield
good length on off and middle, 143 kph, Guptill gets behind the line and defends with a straight bat
strays down leg side, Guptill tries to help it along to fine leg but can't make contact

a length ball angling into the right-hander, around middle and leg, Guptill stays in his crease and closes the face to try and play on the leg side, the ball hits the outside edge and goes behind point
Neesham stays back to a length ball and punches towards cover, that was 137 kph
130 kph, on a good length around off stump, pushed with a straight bat from the crease towards mid off
good length on off, Philander back to giving away nothing, defended on the off side
Guptill gets behind the line of a good length ball and blocks

Guptill played 11 dots in a row and has now hit a half-volley straight to cover. Such a soft dismissal. When in form he might have hammered that through the infield. The ball was there to be hit and Guptill just fluffed it, there was room too. The umpires check if Philander's front foot is okay, it is, but a small margin.
good length just outside off, Brownlie defends on the off side
Brownlie goes back and pokes tentatively at a length ball just outside off, gets an outside edge past the solitary slip to score his first runs

oh Matthew, what a jinx! That ball was too full to stay back to. Neesham did not move his feet and was stuck in his crease as he tried to drive away from his body and hit the ball through cover. It ricocheted on to the stumps off the inside edge
Latham gets behind the line of a good length ball and defends with a straight bat
141 kph, Morkel hits a good length in line with the stumps and takes the ball across the left hander, Latham lets it go
defended from the crease on the off side
Latham is steady in his crease as he brings his bat across his pad to play the ball to square leg
gets beaten outside off stump by a good length ball that slants across
a fuller length just around off, Brownlie stays in his crease and defends on the off side
shot! A crisp straight drive sends the ball racing between the bowler and mid-off. Philander bowled fuller on off, Brownlie pressed forward and hit through the line
what a reply from Philander, pitches on a perfect length that makes Brownlie prod from the crease, the ball then nips away slightly to beat the bat
defended from the crease on the off side
played off the pads to midwicket
played from the crease towards point
Latham has ducked into a short ball and worn it on the helmet. He dropped to his knees to try and avoid the short ball but it did not get as high as he thought it would. He's okay though
tucked off the hips to fine leg for a single
141 kph, pace and extra bounce, Brownlie is beaten as he fends from the crease, little de Kock collects it above his head
strays on to the hips and Brownlie cashes in, New Zealand need to score off every lose ball here. He tucks it off his pads and times it well through square leg
138 kph, on a good length around off, defended on the front foot
banged in short and Brownlie ducks under the bouncer
Latham tries to drive through the off side but gets an outside edge towards third man
short with width outside off, Latham stays back and cuts into the gap at point, well timed
Duminy overcompensates by drifting down leg side, that's a wide
defended on the front foot on the off side
driven to long off for a single
a full ball on middle and off from round the wicket, driven from the crease to long on
drifts on to the pads, Latham gets down on one knee and sweeps to deep backward square leg
137 kph, on a good length, pitching in line with the stumps and angling across, Latham lets it go
Morkel sprays it outside off, he's going to have to bowl that again
good length and straight, Latham gets behind the line and blocks
short of a length angling across Latham who has a poke outside off from the crease and is beaten
Latham tries to cut, the ball is to full to stay back too and the line is too close to off to cut, he is beaten
defended on the back foot on the off side
defended on the front foot on the off side
Brownlie leans forward and drives the ball from round the wicket to midwicket
Duminy dives full length to his right to cut off the firm push from Brownlie
driven to long off for a single
Latham strides forward and pushes a good length ball to mdiwicket
defended on the front foot on the off side
finally New Zealand get a boundary, Duminy drifts on to leg and Latham sweeps and places the ball well enough to beat both short fine leg and deep backward square leg
medium-pace with the keeper standing back. Length ball just outside off, cut to point
width outside off but Brownlie can't beat the fielder at point with the cut
steps out to slog a ball through midwicket but AB follows him an cramps him for room, mis-timed pull on the leg side
AB bowls his fourth dot ball, good length outside off, it is defended on the off side
pushed towards long on for a single
defended on the back foot towards mid-off, top over from the captain!
played towards point from the crease
driven on the front foot to long off, made a little room outside leg to hit that
short ball and Latham goes back to pull hard to deep square leg, Rossouw dives to his right to save the boundary, that was a long hop and the fielder saved three runs
flicked to short fine leg
driven to cover where the fielder dives to his right to prevent the ball going past
swept to deep backward square leg for one more
Latham goes back and cuts the ball along the ground through point
played off the back foot through midwicket
good length on middle and off, defended with a straight bat towards the bowler

AB's got a wicket off a long hop! That's his maiden ODI wicket. That was so short and Latham should have smashed that for six. Instead he played a little, delicate paddle-pull and hit it straight to short fine leg. This is just weak from New Zealand. They have hardly shown any intent against a part-time part-timer.
good length around off, defended with a straight bat towards the bowler
McCullum strides forward and dabs the ball into the covers for a quick single
knocked off the pads through midwicket for a single
punched off the back foot slightly uppishly through cover, hit it with the bottom of the bat
130 kph, good length around off stump, played from the crease towards point

New Zealand are in tatters. Steyn pitched on a good length around middle and off and the ball went straight through to hit the top of off stump. It did not deviate or anything. Brownlie simply drove down the wrong line with no footwork at all
135 kph, Steyn welcomes Anderson with the bouncer, he ducks under it
131 kph, good length outside off, left alone by the batsman
a low full toss, driven to long on for a single
cut off the back foot through point, he hit that from close to his stumps
McCullum presses forward to a flighted delivery and defends on the off side
blocked into the covers on the front foot
goes back and plays the quicker ball to short leg
the googly and a huge appeal for lbw, McCullum moved across his stumps to glance to fine leg and looked like he got an inside edge
beaten outside the off stump, Steyn gets the ball to shape away from the right hander at pace
played off the pads through square leg, that came into the right-hander and McCullum did not time it well

Anderson takes a moment to register what has happened, and then it sinks in that he has been caught superbly at short midwicket by David Miller. Steyn banged in a short ball, it did not get that high and so Anderson pulled, and pulled hard. He made good contact and the ball flew so rapidly to Miller, who was rock steady at short midwicket

he's been opened up and beaten first ball. Steyn angled the ball into middle, pitched on a good length and seamed the ball away. Ronchi was beaten and the ball passed just over the top of off stump. A worthy ball to lose your wicket to.
punched off the back foot in front of point for a single
played off the hips through square leg
wider outside the off stump, he lets it go

lbw! McCullum goes for the sweep and Tahir roars an appeal and then roars in celebration after the umpire raises the finger. McCullum reviews the decision right away. He was well forward and though there was no bat on it the impact on the back pad was outside the line of off stump. McCullum lives on to try and pick up the pieces of this innings
defended watchfully towards the bowler
McCullum moves back and across to glance the ball towards fine leg, Steyn runs across on the boundary and saves the four
defended on the off side, Tahir runs to his left to field
that's in the air but it's cleared the fielder at mid-off, he tried to play that on the leg side but got a leading edge

he starts with a no-ball because he has knocked over the bails at the non-striker's end with his hand as he delivers, the ball was driven to long off for a single. Whoops, he over-stepped as well but the umpire missed that, New Zealand should have had a free hit
square driven through point for a single
edged! The batsman slashed hard at a short ball that climbed on him outside off and edged it just over de Kock, who jumped high and might have got some glove on it. Oh yes he did
pitches on a good length just outside off and seams away from the right-hander, McCullum pushes forward and is beaten
dropped, cut hard and low to point but the ball carries to Faf who dives to his left but can't hold on
left alone outside off stump
defended on the off side
driven off the back foot through cover into the vacant boundary, too short and wide from Tahir
played from the crease to midwicket
pushed from the crease towards point
strides forward to reach the pitch of the ball and punches to long off
defended on the front foot towards the bowler
played back towards the bowler
Ronchi has come out and started timing it superbly, just punches through the line and times the on-drive to perfection
dabbed off the back foot towards point
stays back and defends a good length ball towards the bowler
punched with a straight bat towards mid-off for a single
good length around off, defended on the front foot towards cover
good length on middle and off, the batsman gets behind the line and defends with a straight bat

another sweep from McCullum, another tremendously excitable appeal from Tahir, once again umpire Davis raises the finger, and once again McCullum reviews. He had lunged a long way forward to sweep and missed. This time he was hit in line with the stumps very low on the front pad by the googly. Was there a bottom edge? Hot Spot doesn't seem to indicate one. The angle is tight. Snicko says no edge too. So if this is going on to hit the stumps, McCullum will have to go. Replays say it's going to hit middle and leg. Gone.
Vettori pushes forward to defend but is beaten by one that slides across him
driven to long off for a single
Ronchi goes back and opens the face to play the ball late, it was the googly and he dabbed it into the gap between backward point and short third man
another googly and this time Ronchi goes back to play on the leg side and gets an inside edge on to his pad
short ball, Ronchi pulls to deep backward square leg
defended on the front foot on the off side
driven firmly back to the bowler
played towards long off for a single this time
Vettori strides forward and defends towards the bowler
another batsman goes while trying to sweep. Bowled this time. It was a flighted delivery in line with the stumps and it dipped under Vettori's bat as he swiped across the line
goes right back and plays the ball back to the bowler
driven on the front foot to mid-off
waits in his crease for the legbreak to turn and then opens the face to play to point
defended on the front foot
played back to the bowler once again, from the crease this time
comes forward to push on the off side but is beaten by the legbreak that bounces a bit more
a fuller ball, driven to long on for a single, there's an overthrow after the ball ricochets off the stumps at the bowler's end
driven to cover but can't the gap
Southee skips outside leg stump and makes room to loft inside out to the cover boundary
slogs it with a flat bat to long off for a single, that was a caught and bowled chance but Duminy could not take it
that's a chance for a caught and bowled, Southee drove it firmly to Duminy's left and he can't hold on
played back to the bowler, along the ground this time
driven to long on for one more
a full toss outside off, driven to long on for a single

bowled by the googly! Southee did not pick it. He stayed back in his crease as the ball pitched outside off and spun back in to hit off and middle stump. Southee just played a half-cut at the delivery, but to be fair it kept a bit low
bowled full outside off, that was flatter and quicker, Boult defends on the front foot
defended on the off side on the front foot
Boult slogs across the line and gets an inside edge that misses leg stump and beats the fielder on the fine leg boundary
that's a wide down leg side
defended on the off side
worked off the pads behind square for a hard-run double
the ball climbs from short of a length and Ronchi gets an outside edge towards third man, but he refuses the single
and that's why he wanted the strike, Ronchi just lines up a short of a length ball and pulls it with a flat bat over mid-on's head
this is better! Morkel goes fuller this time and Ronchi meets it on the front foot and punches straight over the bowler's head, it's gone all the way this time
flicked through midwicket this time and the fielder on the boundary has to dive to prevent a third successive boundary
Boult stays in his crease and pulls his bat inside the line of a short of a length delivery
driven back to the bowler, AB fields in his follow through
a length ball around off, Ronchi pulls to deep midwicket and takes the single, probably thinks there's no need to shield Boult against AB
punched from the crease to long on for a single
nudged down the ground for one more
defended from the crease into the covers
full and straight, Boult gets behind the line and survives by defending
refuses the single after making room by moving outside leg and driving inside out to deep cover
played off the back foot towards point
short ball but Ronchi was through his pull too early and got hit on the body, it was a slower short ball
pushed from the crease towards midwicket and they don;t take a single though the fielder is deep in the circle
makes room by moving outside leg and then slugs a short of a length ball to deep square leg
Boult stays in his crease and defends a low full toss on the leg side, over to Ronchi for the next over
slogged to deep midwicket for a single
Boult slogs across the line and gets a bottom edge that misses the stumps and goes to short fine leg, there's a mix up between the batsmen and they decide not to run in the end
drifts down leg side, wide called, why is AB bowling now?!!?
lines him up and slogs straight down the ground to the long off boundary
driven to long on for a single
slogged with a flat bat to long on for another single

AB has a second wicket! He followed Boult with a slower ball after the batsman made room outside leg stump to hammer the ball across the line. Boult missed and the ball hit the pads outside the line of leg stump and then ricocheted on to the stumps. That kept very low. AB is absolutely beaming
Ronchi now decides to take the single off the first ball, steering the short of a length to third man
McClenaghan jumps back and across to nudge the ball down behind square, that got quite high on the batsman
driven from the crease to midwicket
nearly in the blockhole, played out towards wide mid-on for a single
short of a length, angling across the batman at pace, McClenaghan is beaten
pushed gently off the front foot to mid-off for a single
beaten outside the off stump, that was the googly
goes back and across to defend in front of his stumps
strides forward to defend the ball towards point
pushes forward to defend once again, McClenaghan looks like a decent tailender
moves right across his stumps after Tahir goes round the wicket and nudges the ball with the angle into him through square leg
short ball and Ronchi pulls towards deep midwicket for a single to retain strike
good length and straight, played back towards the bowler, Steyn dives to his right to field
good length on off stump, defended on the back foot on the off side
pushed towards point from the crease
131 kph, on a good length around off, Ronchi stays back and pushes the ball to point
backs away to make room and hit inside out over cover but he ends up slicing the ball over point
nudged towards mid-on and they steal the single so that Ronchi can face the next over
punched off the back foot towards deep mid-off for a single
McClenaghan is beaten outside off as he pushes tentatively on the front foot
defended on the back foot towards the bowler
driven to long off for a single
tossed up outside off, Ronchi makes room and drives inside out through cover to bring up a second half-century in the series, he gets warm applause from the spectators
an appeal for lbw after the googly hits the pad but it was going down leg side
banged in short, McClenaghan ducks under Steyn's bouncer
pushed off the front foot towards mid off and they run a quick single, taking on Philander

fine leg is in the circle and Ronchi manages to tuck the ball off the pads wide of that fielder, Tahir chases and dives full length to try and prevent the four. He is not successful and seems to have hurt his shoulder
good length outside off stump, defended on the front foot towards cover
width outside off stump and Ronchi uses it to steer towards third man
defended back to the bowler and Steyn throws at the batsman's end after fielding
cut off the front foot towards point
a short ball but Ronchi can only pull it to wide long on
steps out to AB but has to defend carefully to the bowler, the delivery was that ferocious
played off the pads towards square leg
McClenaghan charges and lofts AB, is that his third wicket? The ball clears the fielder at mid-on though and plugs in the outfield
McClenaghan manages to play the reverse sweep! Hitting it in front of point that too
a short ball and he ducks under it
MClenaghan charges and slogs, gets a top edge but it falls well short of the fielder at fine leg
tucked off the hips through square leg, they run hard to come back for the second, de Kock breaks the stumps but Ronchi is home
tries to steer a good length ball angling into off stump towards third man but gets a bottom edge into the ground
pushed with soft hands into the covers for a quick single
Steyn bounces McClenaghan, he ducks under it
full and straight, Ronchi drives off the front foot to cow corner and has time for a second
a long hop on leg stump, Ronchi pulls towards long leg and hits the gap
swipes across the line again but misses this time
driven towards point and Ronchi asks McClenaghan to wait
slogs across the line but mis-times the shot to short fine leg
wide outside off stump, so wide that even McClenaghan can't reach it, though he tried quite hard
clipped off the pads towards long on, McClenaghan wants two but he won't get it
McClenaghan gets down on one knee and paddle-sweeps the ball fine, nice and deft, showing up a few of his team-mates on the sweep
pushed off the front foot towards point
driven firmly off the front foot but the fielder at short cover cuts it off
pulled off the front foot to square leg
driven through cover off the front foot for a single
how's that from McClenaghan! He turns his bat the other way outside off stump and plays a neat little reverse dab between the keeper and short third man
McClenaghan charges Morkel and slogs across the line, he misses the length ball
another length ball and McClenaghan swipes across the line, hitting the ball to wide mid-on
sharp bouncer from Morkel takes Ronchi by surprise, he takes his eyes off the ball and plays a half-swat in hope, the ball goes off the top edge and falls short of the man at fine eg

an appeal for caught behind after McClenaghan attempts the scoop over the keeper and the ball lobs to de Kock. South Africa think it's all over but umpire Davis says not out. South Africa review right away and replays indicate that the ball might have grazed the thumb as McClenaghan got down low to get under the ball and scoop. The third umpire decides there's not enough evidence to overturn the decision and McClenaghan has a laugh before batting on ...
smashed hard and low back at the bowler, hits Morkel on the leg during his follow through
banged in short and McClenaghan fends the ball away awkwardly, it lobs up in the air and falls safely behind square
played through midwicket for a single
cut off the back foot and it beats the fielder at point, another fielder chases and pulls it in just inside the rope, Faf gave chase. That brings up the 50 partnership!
defended on the front foot on the leg side
superb from McClenaghan, slog sweeps and executes it superbly, hitting the ball in front of the fielder on the deep backward square leg boundary
defended back to the bowler
worked off the pads to short fine leg for a single
McClenaghan clears his front foot and slogs at a length ball that's pretty straight, he gets an inside edge that misses the stumps and races to the fine leg boundary
what a shot that is! McClenaghan has just lined up a length ball and slammed it back over the bowler's head, clean contact that time
Morkel digs it in shorter and McClenaghan moves out of the way after initially shaping to swipe at it
dug in short again, just outside leg, McClenaghan moves towards the off side to let it pass, should have been called wide even though the batsman moved a long way
Morkel is taking a beating from a No. 11, McClenaghan makes room by moving outside leg and then swings freely, smashing the ball past mid-on
McClenaghan feels he can do anything now! He jumps outside the line of off stump and then tries to scoop a short of a length ball over de Kock, he does not make any contact
full and straight, Ronchi plays it watchfully back to the bowler, all rather mundane after McClenaghan's bravado
so much for mundanity! Ronchi swivels and pulls a short ball, hitting it over the infield and into the gap on the midwicket boundary
plays a lofted cover drive into the deep, falls short of the fielder
McClenaghan jumps outside the line of off stump and tries to glance Steyn past the keeper, gets hit on the pad and runs a leg bye to fine leg
Ronchi does it much more conventionally, steering the ball with an open face to third man

McClenaghan clears his front foot and slogs a short of a length ball to wide long on, New Zealand have broken their record last wicket stand in ODIs two games in a row. Move over Trent Boult, McClenaghan has taken your spot with Ronchi.
McClenaghan backs away and slogs at a short of a length ball outside off, he makes no contact
mis-timed towards mid-on for a single, McClenaghan ran the first hard wanting the second, but decided against it

it's all over! South Africa have been kept in the field for much longer than they would have liked, but in the end it is a thumping victory for them. Ronchi will have to wait for his maiden hundred. He falls after slicing the ball over point but Faf was quick enough to run back and take a well-judged catch
